review: Typical Chili's, good food and service.  Grand Patron Margarita is something special!
Super COLD. I don't know why, but there was a draft under the table and all of us were shivering all the time. Everybody in the area had jackets on! Service was slow but overall, it was alright.

Some of our group of friends gathered to enjoy a bite after a Saturday afternoon meeting nearby. The staff accommodated a drop-in group of nine easily, with only minor delay. The wait staff was friendly and efficient, though drink refills and table needs were not attended to as well as was needed. The food was served hot, The quality of prepared items was moderate. We were pleased with the selection, price range and overall experience. Overall, it was an average visit to an average chain.

Typical Chili's. Staff was hit or miss. Ordered wings, they came out quick, which wouldn't have been bad if they were fresh. Instead they tasted like they had been sitting for an hour, re-fried, then smothered in sauce. Manager fixed that for us though. The rest of the meal wasn't bad.
Service was bad for the second time in a row. Don't play any games as they charge you .99 cents  Also showed coupon for free queso but they still charged me. I will not be returning to this Chilis.

Got here on  a Sunday at about 1pm. We were told it was a 20 minute wait, but as I looked around, there were plenty of empty tables, some in the bar area, some in the regular area. Many of the tables hadn't even been bussed. I approached a manager that walked by and asked why is there a 20 minute wait with all these empty tables. His response was if they seated everyone, the kitchen would become extremely backed up and meals would take longer to come out. Dude, you really need to fix your kitchen!! That is how you lose customers. You make customers wait because your kitchen is slow?? There's a fix for that...get new kitchen staff before your people run your business into the ground!! Kudos to our waitress who more than overcompensated for our wait! She was on too of our needs and our glasses were never empty. Don't know when I've ever really felt someone earned their tip like she did...thank you Kara for your awesome service today!!

Sat for 10 minutes after being seated, restaurant is half empty  without server ever coming over.  finally one came by and told us that we were half in one area and half in one so no one had claimed us.  then it went downhill from there.  Here is a hint when you have a larger group (9) write down the orders or guess what...  you will get them wrong. after waiting for a long time to get our food it was cold, overdone (ordered medium rare and got well done.   Ordered soup and did not get any spoons and it was cold. This was not an isolated incident we have come here  a lot over the past couple of years and it has gone downhill dramatically.   There are some servers that are great and actually can get your food out to you when its still hot but they are few and far between and don't seem to stay.

good selection of menu... longer wait for our food than expected since it didn't look busy.. the customers next to us who came after us got their orders of three burgers before we got our two salad orders..hmm... ordered a diet coke and was told that their soda machine was out of order so we can only get water, yet we were charged for a beverage so had to get that removed. it doesn't say there is a charge for the games on that tablet...but you'll get a charge for it.

The wait is always ridiculous if you go at peak time. I don't feel like it's because so many people are there waiting to eat though. I think it's because the staff is just THAT slow. What may be a 45 minute dining experience anywhere else is easily doubled here. And don't come here thirsty, because you may sit the entire time and never get a drink refilled.  The cooks must be alright though, because the food in generally is prepared correctly and tastes good. It's just hard to enjoy a good food experience when the rest of the experience is so frustrating.

I love chilis and I stopped coming to this one a few years ago because of the service. BUT recently they have gotten a NEW MANAGER and he is amazing! I asked for a medium well steak one time and it was more well done, too much for me. He fixed it no problem. I always sit in the bar because the bar tender (skinny male) is always super nice and is an amazing server as well as bartender. Another good server is a young male with gauges and tattoos, which I have had before and is super sweet as well. If the kitchen staff ever messes up on our meals the staff is always friendly and fixes it no matter what. This Chili's is starting to go back up hill and is becoming better everytime I go in! I love this chilis!

Chili's chips and salsa is my favorite appetizer...it's even better when it's free. Subscribe to their email list to take advantage of their rewards club.  Entrée was so-so. Had the chicken and steak fajitas. Steak meat was chewy and overdone. Not a lot of flavors going on either.  The waitress was friendly and helpful but failed to refill the drink of the person I was eating with.

We need an adult to manage this restaurant please. Dirty floors. Trash on shelves. Cold food. I don't expect a lot from a chili' sand this one met my expectations. 16 dec 2015 Add- rotten cucumber in my wife's salad.

Had a good lunch today.  I ordered the pick 3 top shelf tacos.  I chose the steak, chicken, and spicy shrimp.  Surprisingly, the spicy shrimp was the most flavorful and wish I would've ordered 3 of those instead!  The chicken and steak were kinda bland.   We also started out with the white spinach queso, which was decent and they freshly make it on every order.  The chips are pretty good too.  Overall, it's been awhile since I've ate at Chili's and they have redone the menu, I think.  It was pretty good though, almost too many choices and the service was good today. One side note I'd make about the kiosks at the table.  The paper never rips out easy when you print a receipt and I end up messing the machine up. Maybe it's user error, but I like the idea.

Definitely won't return. Gave this place a third chance after numerous issues with food quality in their to-go area. Sadly was a last minute option so close to home as we dined in on 2/16. Floors were nasty, way understaffed which resulted in poor service and empty drinks. Can't expect a lot from a Chilis but when co-workers are aimlessly walking around doing nothing maybe help out those who are busy by refilling water and tea? Last time we visit this location for sure.

Worst chilis by far. It never fails... our order is ALWAYS wrong. It's not a pleasant experience when you always have to return the food. And it has happened whether we eat in or order take out. If I remember correctly, the last time we complained to the manager, he told us that he was new and taking over, knew they were all messed up, etc. Didn't apologize or anything. With that said, shouldn't talk bad about your employees and not only that, why are things worse than before? Will definitely be traveling to another chilis even though this one is down the street.

Did Chilis as a whole change their food for the worse or just this one? We've used the to-go services twice and both experiences with the food quality have been extremely disappointing. The chips were good, but the salsa (which is usually my favorite) has definitely changed over the past year, it was more like tomato sauce. We ordered the sirloin, asked for medium and it was definitely well done (glad I didn't order one well done.) Also the chicken crispers were an extremely poor excuse of chicken. They looked like chicken gizzards covered in sauce, yuck. And the loaded mashed potatoes were extremely bland, instant potatoes with shredded cheese on top...  I'm not sure if the dine in experience is any better but from reading other reviews it's not. Definitely won't be returning for a third time.

We have always loved Chili's food but have had the WORST luck with service at this location and the one off of I-240. The one off of I-240 is probably the worst, and considering I gave them one star, I guess I'll give this one two since we've had a little better luck here than there. The Midwest City location has by far been the best with great service, every time we've gone with the exception of one very busy night. Such a shame because they actually have some good variety and tasty choices but the service is so typical of a chain. Bad management that isn't supervising their staff and quality of service.

I don't think i will be back for a long time. Our waitress was HORRIBLE. She was very rude and sarcastic, she didn't introduce herself and was on her phone . (Which i have a picture of) People were waiting at the door for ever. I am a waitress myself and i was very disappointed . The Cajun Pasta was great! I would say that's the only reason i gave them two stars.

Walked in the door. Waited five minutes for hostess to seat us. Waited another 10 minutes for a sever that never showed. However, when we got up to leave the server came and picked up our menus. Then chilies out reach team responds with a link that doesn't work. Go figure.

What the hell? Where is my food? If you want to bring it out, I'm sitting at the bar. UPDATE... I like cold fries and burnt 'old timer' with no tomato and onion. And no I don't want anything else! #Yuckdontcomedontwasteyourmoneythefoodsucks

What an odd start. The manager seated me and sat down across from me while taking my drink order. He gave me two appetizer menus instead of one normal one. I'm not sure if he was high or just stupid. He also did not dress for the job. He took my order instead of my waiter who I never saw but was told I would see. They did give me free chips and salsa so that was a plus. It looked as if the manager was the host, manager, and waiter, but he didn't do any of that very well. I wish I could have had a real waiter. The food was fairly good as usual at chilis. They gave me bone-in wings when they usually come boneless in a triple dipper and didn't ask me. That was pretty irritating. The food arrived promptly though and drink refills are regular. I wasn't checked on regularly after I received my food. This location is always odd, the chilis in Edmond is much better. I enjoy chilis in general but this one is always off, one way or another.

Well. I had to edit my 2 star review from 6 months ago to 1 star for this latest/last visit. Friday night. 8pm. 2 of us were sat a booth. He ordered the appetizer sampler. I order the 2 meat fajitas. Trying to stay low carb, in place of the rice and beans I requested broccoli & hesitantly the asparagus, only because I am pretty pick regarding asparagus. The waitress stated for the asp, it would be a dollar more. That combined with my slight worry, I chose double broccoli. Our meals were served. 1 of his 3 apps were incorrect, we never said anything. My broccoli however came out very obviously with brown highlights and raw. Several minutes later when our waitress returned I mentioned it. She promptly removed it, asked to replace it and took it to the kitchen. Approximately 10 minutes later she returned asking "They didn't bring you your broccoli"? They had not, she was on it. She came back about a minute later stating they had made another batch and it was still brown. I was confused and said, it really shouldn't ever be brown, even before attempting to steam it. We laughed and she offered a double side of asp without the upcharge. I had about 3 bites left and asked how long she thought that would take considering I was nearly thru with my meal. She said about 3 minutes. I said sure (planning on putting it in a to-go box). She asked if there was anything else I needed and I said we would go ahead and take our tab. (He was done by this point). She said ok and added that she had asked the manager to stop by our table also. I said ok, thank you. About 1 minute later, a large man in a polo shirt with an ear piece walks up and slides a plate of broccoli on our table. I initially started to say, "Oh our waitress has an order of asp being......." when I was interrupted by him. As he throws his hands back over his shoulders and states "I don't know anything about that". I again attempt to explain when he interrupts again beginning to appear slightly agitated and says rather patronizingly, "I went in the back and hand picked a bunch of fresh broccoli and cut it just for you so it would be green".    :o     So they actually had fresh broccoli the entire time lol. He was obviously in a hurry and had no desire to "smooth things over" with us so I just said okay and thank you. Our waitress returns with the tab and says "I see they brought you broccoli. I said yes. She hands me my tab and says that the mgr comped some of our food for us. I say thank you. Unfortunately between the broccoli still being raw a 2nd time (but green-yay!) and the amount the manager comped ($2.40) seeing as how I still hadn't received a double side........I had finally reached the end of my rope. I requested the waitress to have the manager return. I was ready for someone who might of been frustrated but not by any means what I was about to get. The manager appears. I start to talk and he immediately yet again starts talking over me. I then decide that didn't work for me last time so I put my hand up as if to say stop and state, "You are a horrible manager. You should never talk over a customer like you consistently have when they have a valid complaint". He places his hands on his hips and rolls his eyes and I then say "In all actuality, the amount you've comped off our ticket is kind of a slap in the face. That is less than the cost of my iced tea. How much is a side"? He states "1.99". I then say, "The least you could of done is comped 3.98 seeing as how I still have a plate of double raw broccoli". Get this, no joke....He then reaches for our tab while yelling "I don't have to listen to this!!!!", crumples it up, throws it back across our table and continues yelling as he walks off, "Your meals are on me"!!!  We were uh....in shock. It would be more understandable if he had been met with a hostile/rude customer but we never once  I raised our voices or used foul language. Our waitress and the other members of staff we came in contact with were phenomenal. The fajitas (beef & shrimp) were actually REALLY good but we absolutely could not believe that someone in customer service decided to act like that, much less a manager. Our waitress apologized for his outburst, we assured her it was not her fault, tipped her and left. We found out the managers name was Cisco.
Wanted baked potato soup, out of that.  Wanted beer-battered ribs, out of that seasoning, wanted salted caramel molten cake, out of that.  Three strikes, they're out.

DO NOT ORDER TAKE OUT from this location. I placed an On Line Order. When I got to the Take Out window I saw a to go box sitting on the counter. Turned out to be my order. I asked why it wasn't under the heat lamp. 'We can't do that'. Hmmm why when I have ordered this from other (out of state) restaurants the food is kept hot under a heat lamp until picked up. My fajita order was COLD. Nothing was warm. It felt as if the order was cooked ahead of time and put in a refrigerator to save time. The flour tortillas were hard, cold and soggy from sitting in the little fajita juices.  It wasn't as if the order was ready to go. I had to ask for a bag , napkins and plastic ware.  A waste of $18.00...  NEVER AGAIN

Wow - What to say. We came in to have dinner here last night about 5:15. Barely anyone there. We got seated immediately, the server brought our water, then we NEVER SAW HER AGAIN. We waited, and waited, and waited. She never came back. After 18 mins. We got up and left. We saw the manager at the bar, shooting the bull with all the staff. No wonder we NEVER got to give our order. And they saw us leaving and never batted an eye. Chili's used to be consistently good - both good and service. But now it's just a tired, lackluster has-been chain of yesteryear. I've had bad experiences in Norman, OK, Manhattan, KS, and now Moore, OK. I'm done giving you chances, Chili's. It's time to break up and go our separate ways. :-(

We had excellent service from Rebecca I think her name was. Food came out on time! Food came out hot! Food came out correct! This was a fantastic date night experience.  Our drinks were filled when they got halfway empty. Table side guacamole was our appetizer delicious! We split chicken & waffles and we were pleasantly surprised! The portions were perfect and overall had a fantastic date night. Thank you Chili's and Rebecca for being awesome!

The only reason I'm even giving a two star rating is because the food was perfect. The service on the other hand couldn't have been any worse. We came in to eat about an hour before close. I get it. You all wanna go home by this point, but treating your guests the way our server did is uncalled for. Rolled her eyes and huffed when she sat us. Didn't ask if we needed anything the entire time. I'm a server myself so I understand people coming in close to closing time, but we just got finished seeing a movie and we were here an hour before close. I will never come to this location again. Unbelievable.

The manager and waiter were fantastic. We came at lunch hour. It was super busy but they got us in quick. We ordered Texas cheese fries and the cooks forgot to start cooking them. So the manager got us free chips and salsa. :) We were appreciative because we had a our 2 year old with us. And the waiter started to make the fries for us. The food was delicious :)  I am super happy with my experience here. :) I will be coming back :)

Great waiter. Fantastic manager who checked on us often.  Now the food. MEH. As a mom, I joked with the manager that I need to come back there and show the chef how to cook. Oh man. Won't be back. Chili's needs to teach their chef some basics. We are driving home now with our food that I will reprep and recook on my grill for the family. Lol
Service SUCKS tonight and the little hostess with braces is rude and incompetent.  Pull it together, Chili's! You have way to much competition blossoming around you.

If you want to get food in a timely manner, don't go here. Our server was nice enough and took our orders very quickly. None of my group ordered an entree, all of us just ordering appetizers and sides instead. The problems started after we ordered, we spent over an hour just sitting and waiting for our food. One person in the group got their appetizer about 30 minutes in and the rest of us spent another 30 minutes waiting. The food was okay but I was not impressed. I asked the server why it was taking so long to get a few apps and sides out and he said their were two large parties that came out in before us, even though of one the parties he was referring to sat down after us.  The server was nice enough, he seemed to be doing what he could with the large amount of people so I don't blame him for this experience. I just blame this Chili's location that needs to get its act together. I saw another customer complaining as well so this definitely wasn't a out of place experience.

Come into town for work looking for a quick dinner to take to hotel. Ordered 2 sante fe grilled chicken salads, one no pico and one no tortilla chips. That part got right but the chicken is really bland doesn't seem to have any flavor to it and they totally forgot the avocado in both salads.  Got the southwest rolls and those are yummy but don't see the price for these salads worth what we got! And for a Togo order no plastic ware to go with it ! ..... sorry chili's usually your one of my go to's but this location is my stay away from.
